nodes.body:
Please check whether (line 195 now)
```
def Language.IsContextFree (L : Language T) : Prop :=
  âˆƒ g : ContextFreeGrammar.{uT} T, g.language = L
```
or
```
def Language.IsContextFree (L : Language T) : Prop :=
  âˆƒ g : ContextFreeGrammar.{uN} T, g.language = L
```
is correct. I don't understand the universe-polymorphic stuff.

> It really feels like this PR contains two things:
> 
> * Maps of symbols and grammar lifting
> * Closure under union
> 
> If you agree, could you split the PR accordingly?
> 
> EDIT: This is literally what your PR description says. Please split up PRs when you know they are made of several things! No need to wait for us to tell you to split it.

I mean, the latter proves that the former is done right.
Without the closure under union, you will have tp check everything manually that it is done in a way that will allow later proofs to be simple.

> I mean, the latter proves that the former is done right.

It's perfectly fine to justify the design decisions made in PR A by pointing to PR B which depends on A.

LGTM

It really feels like this PR contains two things:
* Maps of symbols and grammar lifting
* Closure under union

If you agree, could you split the PR accordingly?

EDIT: This is literally what your PR description says. Please split up PRs when you know they are made of several things! No need to wait for us to tell you to split it.
I suggest moving ` rw [bef] at hwâ‚` to line 363 (before the last `rcases`), and removing it here and at line 401, because `hwâ‚` is never used without rewriting `bef` at it.

```suggestion
      refine âŸ¨rin, ?_âŸ©
```
maybe moving the `obtain` before this is nicer, but I'm not sure!

```suggestion
    refine âŸ¨hrâ‚€, ?_âŸ©
```

```suggestion
      rw [Function.comp_apply, sinkSymbol, liftSymbol, Option.map_eq_some']
      simp only [Symbol.nonterminal.injEq, exists_eq_right, G.sinkNT_liftNT]
```

```suggestion
      obtain âŸ¨nâ‚€, hnâ‚€âŸ© : GoodLetter (Symbol.nonterminal r.input) := by apply hwâ‚; simp
```
All the other `exfalso`s other than this one can be removed without any other modifications, saving 10 loc.
I know. However, skipping `exfalso` obfuscates the intention in given part of the proof.
Ah I see, sorry for the noise and thanks for clarifying!
It's better to point out something (to make sure it is intentional) even if no code change results from it.

```suggestion
private lemma in_union_of_in_right (hw : w âˆˆ gâ‚‚.language) :
    w âˆˆ (ContextFreeGrammar.union gâ‚ gâ‚‚).language :=
  have deri_start :
    (ContextFreeGrammar.union gâ‚ gâ‚‚).Derives [Symbol.nonterminal none]
      [Symbol.nonterminal (some (Sum.inr gâ‚‚.initial))] := by
    refine ContextFreeGrammar.Produces.single
      âŸ¨âŸ¨none, [Symbol.nonterminal (some (Sum.inr gâ‚‚.initial))]âŸ©,
        List.mem_cons_of_mem _ (List.mem_cons_self ..), ?_âŸ©
    rw [ContextFreeRule.rewrites_iff]
    use [], []
    simp
  deri_start.trans (Symbol.liftString_all_terminals gâ‚‚g.liftNT w â–¸ gâ‚‚g.lift_derives hw)
```

```suggestion
private lemma in_union_of_in_left (hw : w âˆˆ gâ‚.language) :
    w âˆˆ (ContextFreeGrammar.union gâ‚ gâ‚‚).language :=
  have deri_start :
    (ContextFreeGrammar.union gâ‚ gâ‚‚).Derives [Symbol.nonterminal none]
      [Symbol.nonterminal (some (Sum.inl gâ‚.initial))] := by
    refine ContextFreeGrammar.Produces.single
      âŸ¨âŸ¨none, [Symbol.nonterminal (some (Sum.inl gâ‚.initial))]âŸ©, List.mem_cons_self .., ?_âŸ©
    rw [ContextFreeRule.rewrites_iff]
    use [], []
    simp
  deri_start.trans (Symbol.liftString_all_terminals gâ‚g.liftNT w â–¸ gâ‚g.lift_derives hw)
```
Don't you want to extract `deri_start` to a separate lemma?
Good point, yes!
You can try to prove `deri_start` only once and use it twice!
When I extracted `deri_start`, lean complaint about a type mismatch. Is this due to some weird type inference?
I'll fix it.

Well, you didn't generalize it.
You just copied the statement for `gâ‚.initial` â€” which cannot work in the `gâ‚‚.language` lemma.
It will require some deeper refactoring, which I currently don't have time for.
After discussing this with Martin on Zulip, we concluded that it is best to leave this minor duplication. The code needed to avoid it would be complex and not useful for anything else.

```suggestion
theorem Language.IsContextFree.union {Lâ‚ Lâ‚‚ : Language T} :
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma ContextFreeGrammar.language_union :
    (gâ‚.union gâ‚‚).language = gâ‚.language âˆª gâ‚‚.language :=
```

```suggestion
/- This section contains only auxiliary constructions that will shorten upcoming proofs of
```
Shouldn't that be `Symbol.map`?
Don't we have too many `.map`s already?
and here, following `List`, this should be `Symbol.filterMap`, or alternatively `Symbol.reduceOption âˆ˜ Symbol.map sinkN`

I am a bit worried that `Symbol.map` and `Symbol.filterMap` will make it look like they are both intended to be used in the same direction. The intention here is that they are used as almost inverses.
I don't think this definition should exist
Would you delete `Symbol.sinkString` as well?
Yes, similarly

I think that's worth being in the docs
```suggestion
/-! This section contains only auxiliary constructions that will shorten upcoming proofs of
```
Even if that's how you use it, there is no notion of `N` being bigger than `Nâ‚€` here, right? Also this is not a lifting operation. Mind clarifying the docstring?
I mean, I require injective map from `Nâ‚€` to `N` so we can say that `N` is bigger. However, I welcome your suggestions for reformulation.
Where do you require that it's injective? Certainly not in the definition
Same here. And I'm not sure anyone would know what "sinking" means here
Yeah, the docstrings need change.

That's not a very descriptive field name. Maybe
```suggestion
  lift_mem_rules : âˆ€ r : ContextFreeRule T gâ‚€.NT, r âˆˆ gâ‚€.rules â†’ r.lift liftNT âˆˆ g.rules
```
?

```suggestion
has a corresponding rule in the smaller grammar. -/
```

Can you eliminate the `And` and `Exists`?
```suggestion
      r âˆˆ g.rules â†’ âˆ€ nâ‚€ : gâ‚€.NT â†’ liftNT nâ‚€ = r.inputâ†’
```

```suggestion
  gâ‚€ : ContextFreeGrammar.{uN} T
```
Your docstring sounds like `LiftedContextFreeGrammar` is an operation, or it's really not. Mind clarifying the docstring?
Yeah. I should definitely rephrase it as a structure that represents a pair of grammars over the same terminal alphabet such that (...).
Mind giving more descriptive names than `g` and `gâ‚€`?
Can you please suggest something?
Maybe `sourceGrammar`/`originalGrammar` and `liftedGrammar`?

```suggestion
lemma LiftedContextFreeGrammar.produces_filterMap {G : LiftedContextFreeGrammar T}
```
and below
